distributional 0.3.0

The Pareto distribution

Source: R/dist_pareto.R
dist_pareto.Rd

dist_pareto(shape, scale)

Arguments

shape

parameters. Must be strictly positive.

scale

parameters. Must be strictly positive.

See also

actuar::Pareto

Examples

dist <- dist_pareto(shape = c(10, 3, 2, 1), scale = rep(1, 4))
dist
#> <distribution[4]>
#> [1] Pareto(10, 1) Pareto(3, 1)  Pareto(2, 1)  Pareto(1, 1) 

mean(dist)
#> [1] 0.1111111 0.5000000 1.0000000       Inf
variance(dist)
#> [1] 0.0154321 0.7500000       Inf       NaN
support(dist)
#> <support_region[4]>
#> [1] [0,Inf] [0,Inf] [0,Inf] [0,Inf]
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1] 0.11303058 0.10299648 0.30522285 0.08424614 0.12328403 0.15191807
#>  [7] 0.04044715 0.05832754 0.02754418 0.01309239
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 0.07831093 0.28232411 0.52262347 0.39320600 0.02932727 2.99620151
#>  [7] 0.20012127 0.14955654 0.42095082 0.09434737
#> 
#> [[3]]
#>  [1]  0.50560203  0.25504400 44.41940550  0.20969280  0.12985564  2.36728667
#>  [7]  0.20626387  0.07521561  2.86001306  0.65414963
#> 
#> [[4]]
#>  [1] 1.617384610 1.076881850 8.805577269 2.500302092 5.729262143 0.001066967
#>  [7] 2.494662983 4.799395124 2.515644391 0.021627175
#> 

density(dist, 2)
#> [1] 5.645029e-05 3.703704e-02 7.407407e-02 1.111111e-01
density(dist, 2, log = TRUE)
#> [1] -9.782150 -3.295837 -2.602690 -2.197225

cdf(dist, 4)
#> [1] 0.9999999 0.9920000 0.9600000 0.8000000

quantile(dist, 0.7)
#> [1] 0.1279449 0.4938016 0.8257419 2.3333333
